Description: Disconnect between short-term actions and long-term objectives
Coordination between departments and administrations is tedious, and workflow between them is time-consuming.
We are in an election campaign period, and this will affect the NBS implementation process.
Achieving visible results in the short term is a priority.
Bidding processes are often complex, and it is not possible to assign specific staff to develop bidding processes for innovative actions.
Discontinuity between short-term actions and long-term plans
There is tension between the agendas of central and local governments, and/or they are from different parties
There are frequent changes in local authorities or other governing administrations.
There are no common interests between metropolitan municipalities and district municipalities, which may affect the implementation of NBS.
Austerity policies may affect the implementation of NBS.
Revisions to strategic plans affecting the project area
There is a physical plan that may affect the development of nature-based solutions.
There is a thematic strategic plan that may affect the development of nature-based solutions.
Long-term revisions to strategic plans affecting the project area
There is a physical plan that may affect the development of nature-based solutions.
There is a thematic strategic plan that may affect the development of nature-based solutions.
Country-specific political obstacles
Infrastructural barriers
Authorities are locked into the “practice of carrying out infrastructure works”
Limited structural capacity of affected buildings to support the weight of green infrastructure
Lack of construction companies with proven experience in building NBS in the local environment.
Technical barriers to plant and tree selection and interventions
Location of interventions in urban space
Authorities are stuck in the “practice of carrying out infrastructure works”
Country-specific technical obstacles
Basic local legislation is not complied with
The landowner may not be interested in NBS
Land use is restricted due to legal conditions
Local permits for construction work can cause delays.
Lack of local ordinances and regulations.
Lack of coordination for public-private collaboration.
Organizational barriers.
Conflicts between departments and/or lack of collaboration.
Vertical/horizontal hierarchical work culture.
Lack or absence of organizational learning capacity.
Lack of commitment to programs.
Country-specific legal obstacles.
Knowledge gaps - Fear of the unknown
Lack of information on NBS projects
Concerns about skater participation and the impact of human-nature interactions
Uncertainties about NBS implementation and maintenance
Lack of awareness
Lack of awareness about climate change and the benefits that NBS bring to city residents
Ecological gentrification and social inclusion
NBS can increase the real estate value of land
Growth paradigm
The city has slowed its growth: investment efforts are mainly devoted to economic ends.
Country-specific socio-cultural obstacles
Perception of the valuation of ecosystem services
The city cannot support the monitoring and evaluation of NBS.
Public-private partnerships
There are no opportunities for public-private partnership agreements.
